did.head: Overview

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Physicians for Social Responsibility (U.S.). Mid-Peninsula & Stanford Chapter.

did.unittitle: Physicians for Social Responsibility, Mid-Peninsula & Stanford Chapter, Prescription for Prevention proceedings
did.abstract: Proceedings from a symposium on nuclear war held at Stanford University in October 1983. Speakers included Gordon A. Craig, Admiral Noel A.M. Gaylor, Sidney D. Drell, Erik H. Erikson, Alexander Sakharov, Helen Caldicott, Victor W. Sidel, Melvin Konner, and Robert Karl Manoff.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Physicians for Social Responsibility, Mid-Peninsula & Stanford Chapter, Prescription for Prevention Proceedings (SCM0115). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Proceedings from a symposium on nuclear war held at Stanford University in October 1983. Speakers included Gordon A. Craig, Admiral Noel A.M. Gaylor, Sidney D. Drell, Erik H. Erikson, Alexander Sakharov, Helen Caldicott, Victor W. Sidel, Melvin Konner, and Robert Karl Manoff.
